para: Use long waypoint notes, overriding the built-in version check (which is reverse engineered) that tests if the unit can handle the waypoint comments longer than 800 bytes.
This option will probably go away in time as most units get upgraded to the capabilities of the 2.5 version of the PN-40, but this is here for the PN-20 and PN-30 which are less well known for now.
